title: Rape convict Prajwal Revanna now a library clerk in Bengaluru jail
description: Prajwal Revanna, the former Hassan MP convicted in a rape case, has been assigned work as a library clerk at Central Prison, Parappana Agrahara, where he is serving his life sentence. He started his duties a week ago, which include issuing books to inmates and maintaining library records.

title: Team India on alert? Pak's Mohammad Nawaz's hat-trick sends shockwaves before Asia Cup
description: Pakistan showcased their Asia Cup readiness by defeating Afghanistan in the tri-series final. Mohammad Nawaz's exceptional 5 for 19, including a hat-trick, dismantled Afghanistan for a mere 66. Earlier, Rashid Khan's 3 wickets restricted Pakistan to 141. Nawaz's all-round performance and Pakistan's dominant bowling display secured a convincing 75-run victory, boosting their confidence ahead of the Asia Cup.

title: 'Respect laws': Trump’s call to foreign firms after Hyundai plant raid
description: Following a raid at the Hyundai plant in Georgia resulting in the arrest of 475 illegal workers, including South Korean citizens, President Trump issued a stern warning to foreign companies investing in the US. He emphasized the importance of adhering to American immigration laws while welcoming foreign investment. Trump urged companies to bring their skilled workers legally and prioritize hiring and training American workers.

title: NFL star Josh Allen opens up on routine; never skips date night with Hailee Steinfeld
description: Josh Allen, fueled by a new contract and marriage to Hailee Steinfeld, is laser-focused on delivering a Super Bowl to Buffalo. Despite his fame, Allen maintains grounding rituals like weekly dates with Steinfeld and pre-game vomiting. He also fosters team unity through dinners with fellow quarterbacks, all while Steinfeld offers quiet support from the stands.

Hazarika's legacy, celebrated through awards and infrastructure projects, continues to inspire empathy and cultural appreciation.

description: As the earth orbits the sun, a star’s position relative to other stars might seem to shift. This is called stellar parallax. This is because every six months, the earth is on opposite sides of the sun, providing two different viewpoints. You can achieve the same effect by looking at a candle first with only your left right and then only your right

The resolution, presented by Piyush Goyal, celebrated the unified market replacing the cumbersome tax regime. Modi attended the 'Sansad Karyashala,' engaging with MPs and emphasizing active participation in parliamentary discussions.

description: B Sudershan Reddy, opposition's vice-presidential candidate, has urged MPs to vote beyond party lines, emphasizing the need to protect the nation's soul. He lamented that current government policies marginalize weaker sections and youth, suggesting partisan interests influence Rajya Sabha proceedings. Reddy positions himself as an impartial custodian of parliamentary traditions, aiming to restore dignity to debate.

title: Report: Taylor Swift to cut Blake Lively ties amid Kelce wedding plans
description: Taylor Swift is reportedly planning to formally distance herself from Blake Lively, potentially relinquishing her godmother role amid growing tension stemming from the 'It Ends With Us' legal battle. Swift aims to set boundaries and focus on her relationship with Travis Kelce, avoiding further entanglement in the Lively-Reynolds drama. This decision marks a significant shift in their once close friendship.

title: US Open: Alcaraz beats Sinner to win sixth major title; reclaims top ranking
description: Carlos Alcaraz won against Jannik Sinner in the US Open final in New York. Alcaraz claimed his second US Open title and sixth Grand Slam championship. This victory allows Alcaraz to reclaim the world number one ranking. President Donald Trump attended the match, drawing mixed reactions. Alcaraz dominated the match, winning in four sets.

title: Cop dies, 2 missing as MP police vehicle plunges into river
description: In a tragic incident near Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, the in-charge of Unhel police station, Ashok Sharma, died after their vehicle plunged into the Kshipra river while searching for a missing woman. Sub-inspector Madanlal Ninama and woman constable Arti Pal are still missing as rescue operations continue.

title: Nursing dreams held hostage
description: Despite court orders and official bans, private nursing colleges continue to trap students by withholding certificates and enforcing service bonds; PIL seeks regular inspections, grievance redressal mechanism

title: Anuparna Roy’s debut wins big at Venice; first Indian to claim Orizzonti best director
description: Anuparna Roy, a debutant filmmaker from rural Bengal, won Best Director at the 82nd Venice Film Festival for 'Songs of Forgotten Trees.' Roy dedicated her win to the children of Gaza, advocating for peace and liberation. Her parents, initially skeptical of her career choice, now celebrate her achievement, which came decades after Satyajit Ray's Golden Lion win.

description: Activist Bhanu Tatak was prevented from flying to Dublin due to a lookout circular linked to two police cases: criminal trespass in 2021 and defacing a mural in 2022. Police deny the action is related to her opposition to the Siang dam project, while the Youth Congress condemns it as suppression of dissent against the government.

title: Court tells Cognizant you can't use your logo in India; company reacts
description: The Bombay High Court has ordered Cognizant to cease using its logo in India due to a trademark infringement suit filed by Atyati Technologies. Cognizant has complied by removing the logo from its Indian website and social media platforms. This ruling reinstates an earlier injunction, pending resolution of the dispute over the hexagonal honeycomb-style logo.

title: US state dept changes rules; Indians can’t seek faster interviews abroad anymore
description: The US State Department has updated its instructions, requiring non-immigrant visa applicants to schedule interviews in their country of citizenship or legal residence. This change impacts Indians who previously sought quicker appointments abroad due to long wait times in India. Exceptions exist for countries where the US doesn't conduct routine NIV operations, designating specific embassies for those nationalities.

He had traveled to the US via the "donkey route" two and a half years ago. The village is in mourning and supporting the family, who are seeking government assistance to bring his body back to India.

description: The EU is set to unveil its strategic agenda with India on September 17, aiming to strengthen partnership in technology, trade, and security. Both sides are intensifying efforts to finalize a free trade agreement by year-end, with negotiations ongoing. High-level engagements are planned to boost cooperation in counterterrorism and the Indo-Pacific region ahead of the India-EU summit next year.

Opposition parties criticize the plaque's installation as provocative, while the BJP defends it and accuses the National Conference of exploiting the situation. Security has been tightened around the shrine as investigations continue into the vandalism.

The Jaguars hope Hunter can immediately contribute on both sides of the ball, aiding their playoff aspirations.

Police have registered a case against the boy's brother-in-law for rash and negligent driving under section 281 of BNS.

Ukraine war: Trump says US ready for phase-2 sanctions on Russia; follows Moscow’s biggest strike
description: Following Russia's largest aerial assault on Ukraine, which resulted in casualties and significant damage in Kyiv, US President Donald Trump has affirmed his readiness to impose a second phase of sanctions on Russia. President Zelenskyy strongly condemned the attacks, labeling them a deliberate act of war. European leaders, including Macron and Starmer, have also voiced their condemnation of the strikes.

title: Kylie Kelce’s daughters: Life as a mom; Jason Kelce shares parenting joy
description: Kylie Kelce and Jason Kelce have four daughters named Wyatt, Elliotte, Bennett and Finnley. The Kelce family includes parenting in their documentary series. Wyatt is known for her energy at Eagles games. Elliotte shares the family's love for time together. Bennett was born after Jason's Super Bowl appearance. Kylie shares the challenges and joys of raising four young children.

title: Fever vs Mystics: Odds & spread; Top WNBA prop bets and prediction
description: On September 7, 2025, the Indiana Fever are heavily favored against the Washington Mystics at CFG Bank Arena. Betting odds strongly suggest a Fever victory, driven by their superior record, offensive efficiency, and key player performances, particularly from Kelsey Mitchell. While the Mystics' home advantage and rookie talent offer some intrigue, experts predict the Fever will likely cover the spread.

Dilpreet Singh's outstanding performance earned him the Player of the Match award.

description: Microsoft resolved Azure cloud platform issues after Red Sea subsea cable cuts caused latency and service disruptions in the Middle East and Asia. The company rerouted traffic to minimize impact, and services are now operational. While repairs continue, Microsoft is monitoring and optimizing routing to reduce customer impact, as the cable cuts affected internet connectivity in multiple countries.

US recession: Moody’s warns average Americans, these states are at risk
description: Mark Zandi of Moody's warns that the US economy is nearing recession, with states comprising a third of the nation's GDP at high risk. Sluggish consumer spending, tariffs, and housing market struggles contribute to this vulnerability. Revised job reports reveal a hiring slowdown, adding to concerns about rising inflation and eroding consumer purchasing power.

title: Who is ‘Phillies Karen’? Fan who kept Bader HR ball faces backlash
description: During a Phillies-Marlins game, Harrison Bader hit a home run, which a father caught and gave to his son. A woman, dubbed "Phillies Karen," confronted them, claiming the ball was hers and demanding it. The incident sparked outrage online, but Bader later met the boy, signed a bat, and posed for photos to make up for the negative experience.

title: Deion Sanders shares fatherhood advice with Jaguars rookie Hunter
description: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.
